translated: The Collection of Long Sayings .
The Sutta on Shame
One who is ashamed, disgusted,
saying “I am yours,”
not taking up his own actions,

original: Neso mamanti iti naṁ vijaññā.🔽Ananvayaṁ piyaṁ vācaṁ,🔽yo mittesu pakubbati;
analyzed: na isaḥ mamanti iti nam vijaññā  an anvayam piyam vāca  yaḥ mittesu pakubbati
translated: one should know him thus: “He is not mine.”🔽One who speaks pleasant words
to friends without reason,🔽the wise know him
as not doing what he says.

original: Na so mitto yo sadā appamatto,
analyzed: na saḥ mittaḥ yaḥ sadā appamattaḥ
translated: Not a friend is one who is always heedless,
suspicious of divisions, only seeing quarrels;

analyzed: yasmin ca sa iti urasi iva putto
translated: But one who sleeps as a child on his mother’s breast,

original: Sa ve mitto yo parehi abhejjo.
analyzed: sa ve mittaḥ yaḥ parehi abhejjaḥ
translated: that is a friend who cannot be divided by others.
The place that causes joy,
praiseworthy, happiness;
The result of the fruit is developed,
bearing the burden of a man.
Having drunk the taste of seclusion,
the taste of peace,
one becomes free from debt, free from sin,
drinking the taste of the joy of the Teaching.
The third sutta on shame.
